message: This. Show. Is. Great.
Yeah, that's probably true.
Walter ultimately makes the show though
He has no personality, he's just...there.  I mean, describe his personality.  He's...sarcastic, I suppose?
/me is joking
Really? Perhaps maybe on, but I think he's grown.
intelligent, observant?
Agreed.
The first season kind of sucked though
@ericflo I think that's because Olivia was the "main" character. Once they started in on Walter and Peter's story it got amazing
Anna Torv does a great job in that semi-supporting/main role
I will say though that Peter is a super weak character.
Didn't identify with any of the characters
But I'm glad I stuck with it, because it just keeps getting better and better
dreamy? LOL
ha!

Get this: was looking up about 'bromated flour' on wikipedia, and look what it said referencing our dear Walter from Fringe: "In the television show Fringe, one character; Walter Bishop causes an uproar in a supermarket over the use of potassium bromate in strawberry flavoured pop tarts. He refers to the ingredient as 'delicious, strawberry flavoured death'.[5] Hahaha! Choice!
Love fringe its my fav show ;) getting pretty exciting now, anyone heard the rumor about the alt Olivia being pregnant to the our world peter ?

O.M.G. That would be so amazing. Anna Torv has been superb as both Olivias. There are such little, teeny things that she does differently between the two. So subtle. Sometimes I really studied her cause I knew it "felt" different, but couldn't put my finger on it. That's some pretty fine acting.
Hey! First convoree
@mm4rley was right!
haha, so the rumor was true then !!
the pregnancy thing is definitely quite a twist. looking forward to tomorrow night's episode.
heeey, I'm at the start of Season 2, maybe I should stay away from this thread until I catch up :p
spoiler testing... spoiler text totally blew my mind?
d'oh. well, that doesn't work.
Yes, a lot of spoliers.
It got a bit confusing with the two universes, but now it's awesome. Walter is funny :P
This is freaking epic. I just watched the story on Peter's "rebirth". Wow. Does it signify an end of the x-files like cases which have started almost each episode so far?
I hope this show doesn't get cancelled!
@eileentv Same here. I was really dissapointed when FlashForward was cancelled, it was a good TV Show.
Also - thank goodness I'm caught up, because the rumor mentioned earlier in the thread is such a spoiler!
I love Fringe, but I don't see how anyone can say with a straight face that Anna Torv is a good actress.
Yeah it was pretty good
Love it this season is getting good
Actually it was expected since she traveled to the other side she is sensitive to fenomenone
anyone else get a kick out of the ending of the most recent episode
J. J. Abrams has so many good shows and movies, i hope this one stays on longer than six degrees, and undercovers
Yes
Nope that doesn't work either. Darn.
@bishless What about spoiler text trying this?
Great episode the other night... excited to see this season through. Hopefully we get a Season 3
*Season 4
@jmcantrell So true ... so true. I was really disappointed with this last episode ("OS" 2011-03-11). Hearing her trying to do the voice was pretty sad.

@ngerakines Agreed. I'm not sure why being possessed by someone automatically means you have to sound like them. They should just give her the Kostner treatment and tell her to stick to her Olivia voice.
So, what does everyone think of how Olivia did Bell in the latest episode? Did she carry off the voice? The rapport with Walter?

It was a good impression. But that didn't stop me from laughing at every line she uttered. Don't know what William is playing at by flirting with Astrid while he's in Olivia's body.  Olivia is her direct report!  That squicks me.
It was great that she spoke in the same manner as Bell, and I thought she did a very good job.
I thought she did it well still sounded weird thought hope these rumours flying about that's it's going to be cancelled are untrue !
hope the show doesn't get cancelled.
Renewed woooooohoooo
Any thoughts about tonight's episode? It felt kind of slow but the ending was pure Fringe.
Renewed for 4th season -- YAAAAYYY!!!!
I thought it was great. And I can't figure out what the heck Other Walter is up to.

Well, they don't have Peter to power The Machine anymore, but perhaps they think they can use Peter and Fauxliva's son instead. But then it would make you wonder; if they can use Peter's son, why doesn't The Machine react to Walternate (also a genetic relative)?
WHOA.  Loved loved loved this episode of Fringe.
@Anneflo I'm about to watch it; excited.
mmm
So, season finale: thoughts?
@vascobrown I liked it!  Not quite sure what to think though.

I liked it too. I appreciated that the series was renewed so the writers could take the story where they wanted. I grew to expect the unexpected, & they didn't disappoint. It took me a while to figure out what the observers meant at the end. I think Peter realized he had to take himself out of the equation. Perhaps he threw himself into the past, as they had tried to do with the machine parts?
fringe is awesome  J. J. Abrams is a genius when it comes to tv and film
@Anneflo do you think this means that peter will no longer be part of the show?
I've been thinking about that. It's possible he will be re-introduced as a "new" character. He'd be unknown to Liv, Walter & all, but become drawn into the conflict.
